trans-unit.source: Specifies a rotation transformation.

Rotations in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_2d](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-2d-md.md)] usually consist of two arguments: a point around which to rotate an object or set of objects, and a value in degrees or radians that determines the amount of rotation.
In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_3d](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-3d-md.md)], it is necessary to specify a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D> rather than a point around which to rotate.
Rotations in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_3d](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] become more complicated when they are animated.

To animate a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_3d](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] rotation using RotateTransform3D, you can animate the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.AxisAngleRotation3D.Angle%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.AxisAngleRotation3D.Axis%2A> properties of an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.AxisAngleRotation3D>, or specify a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.QuaternionRotation3D> for the transform..
Axis/angle rotations in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_3d](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] are specified in degrees, not radians.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D"></xref> class with the specified rotation.
Rotation3D that specifies the rotation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D"></xref> class with the specified center and rotation.
Rotation3D that specifies the rotation.
Center of the transformation's rotation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D"></xref> class uusing the specified rotation and center coordinates.
Rotation3D that specifies the rotation.
Double that specifies the X value about which to rotate.
Double that specifies the Y value about which to rotate.
Double that specifies the Z value about which to rotate.
Gets or sets the X coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
Double that represents the X coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D.CenterX*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the Y coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
Double that represents the Y coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D.CenterY*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the Z coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
Double that represents the Z coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D.CenterZ*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D"></xref> that specifies the rotation.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
Rotation3D that specifies an angle of rotation about an axis.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D.Rotation*> dependency property.
To be added.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> that represents the rotation.
Matrix3D that represents the rotation.
